metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0407 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0407` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-athena - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-gtk3 - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-gui-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-motif - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-nox - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-runtime - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
vim-tiny - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
xxd - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> if statement that does the vulnerable check introduced by commit 544a38e44db (>= 8.2.2971).

criterions.comment: vim package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1.4').
